course.subject: ECON
course.name: Microeconomic Theory II
course.description: Introduction to general equilibrium theory and welfare economics, economics of information and uncertainty, game theory, theory of contract and organization, topics in modern microeconomics.

reviews.author: Thomas_ECON
reviews.title: Must take for those who want to pursue academic career
reviews.comment_content: Covers the basics of game theory and contract theory. You will learn about equilibrium concepts of games, such as Nash equilibrium, perfect Baysien equilibrium, sequential equilibrium and so on. Classic contract theories are also introduced, including signalling, screening, moral hazard and adverse selection problems.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher has well-written lecture notes, and is fully knowledgeable about the material. He is passionate and inspiring, sending students supplementary materials from the news from time to time.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading. Good grades come with efforts. Everyone seems satisfied with what they got.
reviews.comment_workload: Five to six problem sets, three to four questions each. Some are fairly easy while some may be challenging. Solutions are discussed in class and students have chance to present their answers.

reviews.author: ZKC
reviews.comment_content: The first part of this course introduces topics like Signaling, Cheap talk, and Bayesian Persuasion, one by one. The second part of this course introduces Contract Theory and Mechanism Design as a whole. The worst thing is that what he taught is far less than what contains in exams.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think his teaching is not bad because I can easily understand the concepts.
reviews.comment_grading: The median grade is A-. Although the exams are challenging(average 20 points), the final grading is satisfactory.
reviews.comment_workload: This course only had a mid-term exam and a final exam. It does not have any homework at all although the problem set is provided.
